intro: Oenothera claviformis subsp. wigginsii, commonly known as the Wiggins' evening primrose, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its glandular-hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Onagraceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
